summary: The 'Mitigating Automated Internet Networks for Event Ticketing Act' (MAIN Event Ticketing Act) amends the Better Online Ticket Sales (BOTS) Act of 2016. It strengthens consumer protections against the use of automated bots to purchase event tickets in circumvention of website rules. Key provisions include requiring ticket issuers to implement security measures/safeguards, report circumvention and consumer complaints to the FTC, address causes of circumvention, and coordinate with law enforcement and the FTC to publish compliance guidelines.  Increased penalties for violations and enhanced coordination between agencies are also included.
